raw_text:
Fit-again Betsen in France squad
 
 France have brought flanker Serge Betsen back into their squad to face England at Twickenham on Sunday.
 
 But the player, who missed the victory over Scotland through injury, must attend a disciplinary hearing on Wednesday after being cited by Wasps. "Serge has a good case so we are confident he will play," said France coach Bernard Laporte. The inexperienced Nicolas Mas, Jimmy Marlu and Jean-Philippe Grandclaude are also included in a 22-man squad. The trio have been called up after Pieter de Villiers, Ludovic Valbon and Aurelien Rougerie all picked up injuries in France's 16-9 win on Saturday.
 
 Laporte said he was confident that Betsen would be cleared by the panel investigating his alleged trip that broke Wasps centre Stuart Abbott's leg. "If he was to be suspended, we would call up Imanol Harinordoquy or Thomas Lievremont," said Laporte, who has dropped Patrick Tabacco. "We missed Serge badly against Scotland. He has now recovered from his thigh injury and played on Saturday with Biarritz." France's regular back-row combination of Betsen, Harinordoquy and Olivier Magne were all missing from France's side at the weekend because of injury. Laporte is expected to announce France's starting line-up on Wednesday.
 
 Forwards: Nicolas Mas, Sylvain Marconnet, Olivier Milloud, William Servat, Sebastien Bruno, Fabien Pelous, Jerome Thion, Gregory Lamboley, Serge Betsen, Julien Bonnaire, Sebastien Chabal, Yannick Nyanga. Backs: Dimitri Yachvili, Pierre Mignoni, Frederic Michalak, Yann Delaigue, Damien Traille, Brian Liebenberg, Jean-Philippe Grandclaude, Christophe Dominici, Jimmy Marlu, Pepito Elhorga.
llama3.2:1b: France have brought Serge Betsen back into their squad for the England match at Twickenham on Sunday despite a disciplinary hearing due to an alleged trip that broke Wasps centre Stuart Abbott's leg. The 22-man squad includes Nicolas Mas, Jimmy Marlu, and Jean-Philippe Grandclaude in addition to Betsen.

He will attend a disciplinary hearing but is confident of being cleared by the panel investigating an alleged trip that injured Stuart Abbott. Nicolas Mas, Jimmy Marlu, and Jean-Philippe Grandclaude have been called up to replace injured players.

He will attend a disciplinary hearing for alleged misconduct which may lead to his suspension but he is confident of playing.  France has also called up three new players to their 22-man squad due to injuries sustained against Scotland: Nicolas Mas, Jimmy Marlu and Jean-Philippe Grandclaude. The team's starting line-up will be announced on Wednesday.

Backs: Dimitri Yachvili, Pierre Mignoni, Frederic Michalak, Yann Delaigue, Damien Traille, Brian Liebenberg, Jean-Philippe Grandclaude, Christophe Dominici, Jimmy Marlu, Pepito Elhorga

Two others are included: Mas, Marlu, and Grandclaude, who have also been called up due to injuries. The starting lineup is expected to be announced on Wednesday.

opencoder:1.5b: "Fit-again Betsen in France squad" - France have brought back a player with a injury and made a case for a disciplinary hearing on Wednesday by Wasps. The trio are booked up after injuries in the 16-9 win on Saturday, with Betsen missing. The coach of France says he was confident that he would be cleared by the panel investigating his alleged trip that broke Stuart's leg. The player then recovered from his thigh injury and played on Saturday with Biarritz.
smollm:1.7b: France have brought flanker Serge Betsen back into their squad to face England at Twickenham on Sunday.
deepseek-r1:1.5b:
<think>
Alright, let me tackle this query step by step. So, the user has given a text about a football match in France and wants it summarized into only the key points without any explanations or formatting. 

First, I need to read through the provided text carefully. The main events are that Serge Betsen is returning to France's squad to face England at Twickenham. He missed against Scotland because of injury but will go through a disciplinary hearing on Wednesday.

The coach, Bernard Laporte, says he's confident with him and mentions other experienced players like Nicolas Mas, Jimmy Marlu, and Jean-Philippe Grandclaude who are being called back for the 22-man squad. They were all injured in their previous game, which was against England earlier that week.

Laporte also mentioned that Betsen is cleared by a panel investigating his alleged trip affecting Stuart Abbott's leg. He mentioned excluding some injured players from Friday's game but he will announce the starting lineup on Wednesday.

The forwards and backs are listed, so I need to include those as well for completeness. The text also says that both Betsen and Harinordoquy were missing from France's side last weekend because of an injury, which means they might be starting a bit later than usual.

I should make sure not to include any extra information beyond the key points like the summary, dates, names, and highlights. The user specifically asked for the output only as plain text with no explanations or formatting, so I need to ensure it's concise without any markdown.

Double-checking everything: the main players are Betsen, Laporte, Mas, Marlu, Grandclaude, Harinordoquy, Olivier Magne (who was out), and the rest who were injured. The date is Sunday against Scotland, Wednesday for the hearing, and then on Wednesday they'll announce the lineup.

I think that covers all the important details without adding anything extra.
</think>

Serge Betsen returns to France's squad to face England at Twickenham on Sunday, following his return from injury after missing the defeat over Scotland. He will attend a disciplinary hearing on Wednesday due to being cited by Wasps. The team has a 22-man squad with players like Nicolas Mas, Jimmy Marlu, Jean-Philippe Grandclaude, and others called back for the match. Laporte is confident Betsen will be cleared and mentions that both Betsen and Harinordoquy were out from Friday's game due to injury.
tinyllama:1.1b: France have brought back attacking midfielder Serge Betsen into their squad for the upcoming match against England at Twickenham on Sunday. However, he will need to attend a disciplinary hearing due to an alleged trip that broke Wasps center Stuart Abbott's leg. The full 22-man squad has been announced with the inclusion of Nicolas Mas, Jimmy Marlu, and Jean-Philippe Grandclaude. A decision on Betzen's starting role is expected to be made by Wednesday, following France coach Bernard Laporte's assessment of his fitness. The team is missing regular back-row combinations due to injury. France will be aiming to rekindle their winning streak against England and regain the Rugby World Cup final spot they lost to New Zealand in 2015.

Serge Betsen has been included in the France squad for their match against England at Twickenham after recovering from an injury. The flanker missed the victory over Scotland due to a previous thigh injury. However, he must attend a disciplinary hearing on Wednesday following being cited by Wasps. Coach Bernard Laporte is confident that Betsen will be cleared of any misconduct. Serge's absence in the game against Scotland was felt as France has lost two key players, Ludovic Valbon and Aurelien Rougerie, due to injuries. The inexperienced trio of Nicolas Mas, Jimmy Marlu, and Jean-Philippe Grandclaude are included in a 50-man squad after Pieter de Villiers, Ludovic Valbon, and Aurelien Rougerie all suffered injuries. 

Coach Laporte is expecting to announce France's starting line-up on Wednesday. The forward line includes Nicolas Mas, Sylvain Marconnet, Olivier Milloud, William Servat, Sebastien Bruno, Fabien Pelous, Jerome Thion, Gregory Lamboley, Serge Betsen, Julien Bonnaire, Sebastien Chabal, and Yannick Nyanga. The back line consists of Dimitri Yachvili, Pierre Mignoni, Frederic Michalak, Yann Delaigue, Damien Traille, Brian Liebenberg, Jean-Philippe Grandclaude, Christophe Dominici, Jimmy Marlu, Pepito Elhorga.
granite3.1-dense:2b:
France's flanker Serge Betsen has been reinstated in their squad for the match against England at Twickenham on Sunday, following an injury that sidelined him from France's 16-9 victory over Scotland. However, Betsen must attend a disciplinary hearing on Wednesday due to being cited by Wasps for allegedly causing Stuart Abbott's broken leg during the game. Coach Bernard Laporte remains optimistic about Betsen's participation, stating that if suspended, Imanol Harinordoquy or Thomas Lievremont would replace him.

Injury replacements for the squad include inexperienced players Nicolas Mas, Jimmy Marlu, and Jean-Philippe Grandclaude, who filled in for Pieter de Villiers, Ludovic Valbon, and Aurelien Rougerie. Laporte expects to name the starting lineup on Wednesday, with Betsen expected to play if cleared by the disciplinary panel. The regular back-row combination of Betsen, Harinordoquy, and Olivier Magne were unavailable due to injuries in the previous match.

The forward line consists of Nicolas Mas, Sylvain Marconnet, Olivier Milloud, William Servat, Sebastien Bruno, Fabien Pelous, Jerome Thion, Gregory Lamboley, and Julien Bonnaire, while the backs include Dimitri Yachvili, Pierre Mignoni, Frederic Michalak, Yann Delaigue, Damien Traille, Brian Liebenberg, Jean-Philippe Grandclaude, Christophe Dominici, Jimmy Marlu, and Pepito Elhorga.
